alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 7:58PM MST until February 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: .Snowfall will continue to diminish across the Front Range foothills and adjacent plains this evening. There are still a few bands of moderate snowfall over the plains but any additional accumulation will be an inch or less. You can still expect icy and snowpacked roads. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to three inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous. Travel may become very difficult to impossible due to heavy snowfall on roadways.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Chain and traction laws will possibly be enacted for the mountains. If traveling to the mountains, be prepared for winter driving conditions.
